title: Species Distribution Modeling with H3 Grids
text: h3sdm R package species distribution modeling (SDM) habitat analysis using hexagonal grids based H3. provides consistent spatial framework combine species occurrence data environmental predictors landscape metrics, enabling ecological modeling habitat characterization. Key features include: Conversion point occurrence data H3-based spatial grids. Extraction environmental landscape predictors different resolutions. Support multiple modeling approaches (e.g., logistic regression, GAMs, Random Forest, XGBoost). Tools visualizing model predictions habitat structure. leveraging H3 grids, h3sdm makes easy bridge species distribution modeling landscape ecology scalable way.

title: Generate presence-absence datasets using H3 hexagons — h3sdm_pa
text: species Character. Species name (e.g., "Panthera onca"). aoi_sf sf polygon defining area interest. res Integer. H3 resolution hexagonal grid (default 6). n_neg Integer. Number pseudo-absence hexagons sample (default 500). providers Optional. Data providers get_records_by_hexagon(). remove_duplicates Logical. Whether remove duplicate occurrence records (default FALSE). date Optional. Date filter species records (default NULL). expand_factor Numeric. Buffer factor expand grid beyond AOI (default 0.1).

title: Create a tidymodels recipe for H3-based SDMs — h3sdm_recipe
text: function performs key data preparation steps spatial species distribution modeling: Extracts centroid coordinates (x y) polygon geometries. Removes geometry column, tidymodels works tabular data. Assigns roles columns: presence → "outcome" (target variable) h3_address → "id" (kept joining predictions) x y → "spatial_predictor" columns assigned "predictor" role.
